revised_title: Investigating the Influence of 3He on Vortex Nucleation in Liquid Helium
tldr: The authors studied the effect of adding tiny traces of 3He to pure 4He on the rate of vortex ring nucleation by negative ions. They found that the presence of 3He significantly influenced the nucleation rate, with the effect becoming more pronounced at lower temperatures and electric fields. The authors proposed a model to explain the observed behavior, which they tested and compared with experimental data. This research provides insights into the microscopic vortex nucleation mechanism and the role of 3He in superfluidity.
